response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Map.Entry<String, Double>> it = mylist.entrySet().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  System.out.print(it.next().getKey());
  System.out.println(it.next().getValue());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the getKey() and getValue() methods of the Map.Entry class.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a HashMap in Java: :I have a HashMap<String, String> . I want to get the value of a key. If it is Array we can use  .get[2] ,.get[5] etc. for take 2nd and 5th value. But for HashMap<String, String> how to do it. I used following code. But it print all the values contained in HashMap<String, String>. I need to take separately.    Set set = mylist.entrySet();    Iterator i = set.iterator();    while(i.hasNext()) {    Map.Entry me1 = (Map.Entry)i.next();    System.out.print(me1.getKey());    System.out.println(me1.getValue());
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<Map.Entry<String, String>> it = mylist.entrySet().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  System.out.print(it.next().getKey());
  System.out.println(it.next().getValue());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the getKey() and getValue() methods of the Map.Entry class.
